intro: Adenostemma lavenia var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
